text: Greatest Hits is a hits compilation released by English singer-songwriter Robbie Williams on 18 October 2004. The album has two new songs, "Radio" and "Misunderstood", which were both released as singles. ==Track listing== ==The Best So Far== The Best So Far is an updated version of Greatest Hits, released only in Brazil to celebrate Robbie's Close Encounters tour. Even with Greatest Hits being released in Brazil, The Best So Far updates the track listing, adding "Sin Sin Sin", "Advertising Space" and "Tripping", but removing songs such as "Old Before I Die", "Lazy Days" and "She's the One". ;Track listing #"Sin Sin Sin" – 4:09 #"Advertising Space" – 4:37 #"Feel" – 4:22 #"Angels" – 4:25 #"Sexed Up" – 4:20 #"Millennium" – 4:08 #"Come Undone" – 4:38 #"Rock DJ" – 4:18 #"Supreme" – 4:19 #"Tripping" – 4:07 #"No Regrets" – 5:11 #"Radio" – 3:51 #"Misunderstood" – 4:02 #"Let Me Entertain You" – 4:21 ==Charts== ===Weekly charts=== Chart (2004) Peak position Japanese Albums (Oricon) 60 Mexican Albums (AMPROFON) 3 ===Year-end charts=== Chart (2004) Position Australian Albums (ARIA) 4 Austrian Albums (Ö3 Austria) 6 Belgian Albums (Ultratop Flanders) 11 Belgian Albums (Ultratop Wallonia) 13 Dutch Albums (Album Top 100) 6 German Albums (Offizielle Top 100) 7 New Zealand Albums (RMNZ) 26 Swedish Albums (Sverigetopplistan) 17 Swiss Albums (Schweizer Hitparade) 5 UK Albums (OCC) 3 Chart (2005) Position Australian Albums (ARIA) 11 Austrian Albums (Ö3 Austria) 6 Belgian Albums (Ultratop Flanders) 21 Belgian Albums (Ultratop Wallonia) 44 Dutch Albums (Album Top 100) 9 German Albums (Offizielle Top 100) 5 Mexican Albums (AMPROFON) 8 Swiss Albums (Schweizer Hitparade) 5 UK Albums (OCC) 71 Chart (2006) Position Australian Albums (ARIA) 52 Austrian Albums (Ö3 Austria) 30 German Albums (Offizielle Top 100) 52 UK Albums (OCC) 90 ===Decade-end charts=== Chart (2000–2009) Position Australian Albums (ARIA) 9 UK Albums (OCC) 19 ==Certifications== ==References== Category:Robbie Williams compilation albums
